front.title: Considerations for Benchmarking Network Performance in Containerized Infrastructures

abstract.t: Recently, the Benchmarking Methodology Working Group has extended the laboratory characterization from physical network functions (PNFs) to virtual network functions (VNFs). Considering the network function implementation trend moving from virtual machine-based to container- based, system configurations and deployment scenarios for benchmarking will be partially changed by how the resource allocation and network technologies are specified for containerized VNFs. This draft describes additional considerations for benchmarking network performance when network functions are containerized and performed in general-purpose hardware.
